title: MSS Intern Talk
text:
Eli Lilly and Company






Founded in 1876 in Indiana by Colonel Eli Lilly
A global powerhouse in pharmaceuticals, specializing in medicines for diabetes, oncology, immunology, etc
Operates in 110+ countries with 43,000+ employees worldwide
Trulicity, Mounjaro, Zepbound (diabetes); Kisunla (recently approved for Alzheimer treatment)
The 1st company to mass-produce insulin in 1923

title: MSS Intern Talk
text:
Intern Experience
Clinical Trials
üë©‚Äçüî¨ Biologists / Chemists: discover potential compounds (1M+)
üêÅ Animal Testing (1K+)
üíä Human Testing (100+) -> Clinical Trials:

Phase 1: ~10 cases -> 1st trial in human subject (safety)
Phase 2: ~100 cases -> test out the best dosage (efficacy)
Phase 3: ~1000 cases -> validating the results from previous phases
Phase 4: general population -> after FDA approval, review public/hospital data


Statisticians are vital to the development of new drugs, from study design to approval reporting!

title: MSS Intern Talk
text:
Intern Experience (cont.)
My Work

Computational Stats ‚û°Ô∏è Diabetes | Phase 3
Automate safety reporting pipeline with R Shiny app & SAS, ensuring consistency and efficiency
Review compound protocols and statistical analysis plans; understand study design (hypothesis testing, causal inference, hierarchical modeling, etc); data cleaning / pre-processing / EDA / analysis / visualization (TFL)







Tips



Highly regulated industry: require interpretability and reproducibility
Master (computational: heavy programming) vs.¬†PhD (study design: more math)
Play to your advantage in stats (over biostat/CS/math)

title: MSS Intern Talk
text:
Application Timeline

Dec 2023: Submit application
Mid Jan 2024: HR reach out
Late Jan 2024: Interview (yes just one round)
Offer within a week

Insanely great company, amazing benefits, a lot of Duke alum (but also Tarheels), and opportunity to collaborate with global talents [Headquarter in IN]

title: MSS Intern Talk
text:
Important Courses
Frequently asked in all technical interview:

STA 521 - Predictive Modeling
STA 523 - Statistical Programming (R) & STA 663 (Python)
STA 532 - Statistical Inference

If you target Pharma:

STA 522 - Study Design
STA 640 - Causal Inference
Survival Analysis / Time Series

If you target Data Science:

STA ? - Machine Learning (by Cynthia Rudin)
IDS 721 - Cloud Computing
